These two equations are usually obtained by using the following steps, but any conditions one places on the terminals of the circuit should also work:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; 1. Calculate the output voltage, VAB, when in open circuit condition (no load resistor - meaning infinite resistance). This is VTh.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n2. Calculate the output current, IAB, when the output terminals are short circuited (load resistance is 0). RTh equals VTh divided by this IAB.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&amp;bull;\tThe equivalent circuit is a voltage source with voltage VTh in series with a resistance RTh.&lt;br /&gt;\r\nStep 2 could also be thought of like this:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n2a. Now replace voltage sources with short circuits and current sources with open circuits.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n2b. Replace the load circuit with an imaginary ohm meter and measure the total resistance, R, &amp;quot;looking back&amp;quot; into the circuit. This is RTh.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nThe Thevenin-equivalent voltage is the voltage at the output terminals of the original circuit. When calculating a Th&amp;eacute;venin-equivalent voltage, the voltage divider principle is often useful, by declaring one terminal to be Vout and the other terminal to be at the ground point.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;table cellspacing=&quot;1&quot; cellpadding=&quot;1&quot; border=&quot;1&quot; align=&quot;center&quot; width=&quot;200&quot;&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;136&quot; width=&quot;152&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image001(3).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;138&quot; width=&quot;158&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image002(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;138&quot; width=&quot;149&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image003(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n&lt;/table&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;The Thevenin-equivalent resistance is the resistance measured across points A and B &amp;quot;looking back&amp;quot; into the circuit. It is important to first replace all voltage- and current-sources with their internal resistances. For an ideal voltage source, this means replace the voltage source with a short circuit. For an ideal current source, this means replace the current source with an open circuit. Resistance can then be calculated across the terminals using the formulae for series and parallel circuits.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;Example 1:-&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nFor example,  consider the following circuit.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;187&quot; width=&quot;362&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image004(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Firstly, we have to remove the centre 40&amp;Omega; resistor and short out (not physically as this would be dangerous) all the emf&amp;acute;s connected to the circuit, or open circuit any current sources. The value of resistor Rs is found by calculating the total resistance at the terminals A and B with all the emf&amp;acute;s removed, and the value of the voltage required Vs is the total voltage across terminals A and B with an open circuit and no load resistor Rs connected. Then, we get the following circuit.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;207&quot; width=&quot;307&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image005(1).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Find the Equivalent Resistance (Rs)&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;94&quot; width=&quot;418&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image006(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;Find the Equivalent Voltage (Vs)&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;187&quot; width=&quot;362&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image007(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;We now need to reconnect the two voltages back into the circuit, and as VS&amp;nbsp; &amp;nbsp;=&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;VAB the current flowing around the loop is calculated as:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;62&quot; width=&quot;274&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image008(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;So the voltage  drop across the 20&amp;Omega; resistor can be calculated as:&lt;br /&gt;\r\nVAB&amp;nbsp;=&amp;nbsp;20&amp;nbsp;-&amp;nbsp;(20&amp;Omega;&amp;nbsp;x&amp;nbsp;0.33amps)&amp;nbsp;=&amp;nbsp;  &amp;nbsp;13.33&amp;nbsp;volts.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\nThen the Thevenin&amp;rsquo;s  Equivalent circuit is shown below with the 40&amp;Omega; resistor connected.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;212&quot; width=&quot;299&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image009(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;And from this  the current flowing in the circuit is given as:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;65&quot; width=&quot;297&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image010(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Thevenin&amp;rsquo;s theorem can be used as a circuit analysis method and is particularly useful if the load is to take a series of different values. It is not as powerful as Mesh or Nodal analysis in larger networks because the use of Mesh or Nodal analysis is usually necessary in any Thevenin exercise, so it might well to be used from the start. However, Thevenin&amp;rsquo;s equivalent circuits of Transistors, Voltage&lt;strong&gt; &lt;/strong&gt;Sources such as batteries etc, are very useful in  circuit design.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\nVerification of Thevnin&amp;rsquo;s  Theorem using the simulator,&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Step1:-  Create the actual circuit and measure the current across the load points&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;233&quot; width=&quot;195&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image011(2).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Step 2:- Create the Thevnin&amp;rsquo;s equivalent circuit by first creating the equivalent voltage source and equivalent resistance and then measue the current across the load using an ammeter.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;232&quot; width=&quot;217&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image012(3).jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;In both the cases the current measured across  the resistnace should be of the same value.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
  72      (289,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Components&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tResistor:&lt;/strong&gt; A resistor is a two-terminal electronic component that produces a voltage across its terminals that is proportional to the electric current through it in accordance with Ohm&#039;s law.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tLamp:&lt;/strong&gt; A lamp is a replaceable component such as an incandescent light bulb, which is designed to produce light from electricity. These components usually have a base of ceramic, metal, glass or plastic, which makes an electrical connection in the socket of a light fixture.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tWire:&lt;/strong&gt; A wire is a single, usually cylindrical, elongated string of metal. Wires are used to bear mechanical loads and to carry electricity and telecommunications signals. Wire is commonly formed by drawing the metal through a hole in a die or draw plate.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tSwitch:&lt;/strong&gt; In electronics, a switch is an electrical component that can break an electrical circuit, interrupting the current or diverting it from one conductor to another.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tBattery:&lt;/strong&gt; In electronics, a battery or voltaic cell is a combination of many electrochemical Galvanic cells of identical type to store chemical energy and to deliver higher voltage or higher current than with single cells.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tVoltmeter:&lt;/strong&gt; A voltmeter is an instrument used for measuring the electrical potential difference between two points in an electric circuit. Analog voltmeters move a pointer across a scale in proportion to the voltage of the circuit; digital voltmeters give a numerical display of voltage by use of an analog to digital converter.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tAmmeter:&lt;/strong&gt; An ammeter is a measuring instrument used to measure the electric current in a circuit. Electric currents are measured in amperes (A), hence the name.&#039;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tNon-contact ammeter:&lt;/strong&gt; A type of ammeter that need not be a part of the circuit.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;     &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
  73      (293,'&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Reference:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;           &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot; class=&quot;content&quot; id=&quot;myTable&quot;&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;3%&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;97%&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: block;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9780471320579&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Resnick, Robert et.al. Physics. New York: Wiley, 2002.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\r\n            &lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;script src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books?jscmd=viewapi&amp;amp;bibkeys=ISBN:9780471320579&amp;amp;callback=processDynamicLinksResponse&quot; type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;2.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: block;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9788126518944&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;javascript:togglePreview(&#039;9788126518944&#039;);&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;University Physics, Revised Ed, Harris Benson, Wiley-India, 2008&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\r\n            &lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;script src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books?jscmd=viewapi&amp;amp;bibkeys=ISBN:9788126518944&amp;amp;callback=processDynamicLinksResponse&quot; type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;script type=&quot;text/javascript&quot; src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books/api.js?key=notsupplied&amp;amp;v=0&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;3&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: block;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9780495113690&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Serway, Raymond et.al. College Physics. Australia: Thomson Brooks/Cole, 2006.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\r\n            &lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;script src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books?jscmd=viewapi&amp;amp;bibkeys=ISBN:9780495113690&amp;amp;callback=processDynamicLinksResponse&quot; type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;4&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;IIT-JEE  Physics- S.P.Arya, MTG Books, 2007&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;5&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Electric  circuits- David A.Bell, Oxford University press,  Seventh Edition 2009&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n&lt;/table&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;       &lt;!--\r\n&lt;body onUnload=&quot;checkEmbeddability();&quot; &gt;\r\n&lt;/body&gt;\r\n--&gt;       &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;!--\r\n&lt;p&gt;\r\n&lt;ol&gt;\r\n    &lt;ol&gt;\r\n        &lt;ul&gt;\r\n            &lt;li&gt;Physics  &amp;ndash; David Halliday, Robert Resnick, Kenneth S Krane, Vol. II, 5th (e),  Willey Student Edition, 2002&lt;/li&gt;\r\n            &lt;li&gt;University  Physics.- Harris, Benson, Willey Student Edition, 2004&lt;/li&gt;\r\n            &lt;li&gt;College  Physics Raymond A Serway, Jerry S. Faughn,Chris Vuille, Charles A Bennett,  Vol.II, Thomson Brooks/Cole, 2006&lt;/li&gt;\r\n            &lt;li&gt;IIT-JEE  Physics- S.P.Arya, MTG Books, 2007&lt;/li&gt;\r\n            &lt;li&gt;Electric  circuits- David A.Bell, Oxford University press, Seventh Edition 2009&lt;/li&gt;\r\n        &lt;/ul&gt;\r\n        &lt;/p&gt;\r\n        --&gt; \t         &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Webliography:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;blockquote&gt;\r\n        &lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; 1.\tModified Nodal Analysis. [ &lt;/span&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://www.swarthmore.edu/NatSci/echeeve1/Ref/mna/MNA1.html&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://www.swarthmore.edu/NatSci/echeeve1/Ref/mna/MNA1.html&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; ]&lt;br /&gt;\r\n        2.\tMatrix operations. [ &lt;/span&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_theory&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_theory &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;]&lt;br /&gt;\r\n        &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n        &lt;/blockquote&gt;\r\n        &lt;div class=&quot;postConentPadding&quot;&gt;\r\n        &lt;link type=&quot;text/css&quot; rel=&quot;stylesheet&quot; href=&quot;http://sakshat.amrita.ac.in/VirtualLab/css/default.css&quot; /&gt;&lt;style type=&quot;text/css&quot;&gt;&lt;/style&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;  &lt;br /&gt;\r\n        &lt;/span&gt;\r\n        &lt;div style=&quot;padding-left: 50px;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; &lt;strong&gt;Experiment Mapping &lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n        &lt;/span&gt;\r\n        &lt;table width=&quot;85%&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;caption class=&quot;tableHeading&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/caption&gt;\r\n            &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                &lt;tr class=&quot;tagExpHead&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;th width=&quot;33%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Subject&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n                    &lt;th width=&quot;33%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Courses&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n                    &lt;th width=&quot;34%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Level&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                &lt;tr class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                        &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td colspan=&quot;3&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Physics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- Electrostatics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- Quantitative Circuit Analysis&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/table&gt;\r\n                    &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                        &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;IIT Bombay&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;10%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- B Tech All Branches&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;10%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- M Sc Physics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/table&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n                    &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                        &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Under Graduate (UG)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                            &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                                &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Graduate (G)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                            &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/table&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/td&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n            &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;/table&gt;\r\n        &lt;/div&gt;\r\n        &lt;/div&gt;\r\n        &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n        &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
  74      (295,'&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Ohm&#039;s law applies to electrical circuits; it states that the current through a conductor between two points is directly proportional to the potential difference or voltage across the two points, and inversely proportional to the resistance between them. The mathematical equation that describes this relationship is:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;45&quot; width=&quot;60&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0001.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Example&lt;/strong&gt;:-&lt;br /&gt;\r\nA nine volt battery supplies power to a cordless curling iron with a resistance of 18 ohms. How much current is flowing through the curling iron?&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Sketch:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;134&quot; width=&quot;491&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0002.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Solution:&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;32&quot; width=&quot;97&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0003.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1) Since  V(Voltage) and R(Resistance) are known, solve for I(Current) by dividing both  sides of the equation by R.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;57&quot; width=&quot;97&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0004.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;2) The R&#039;s on  the right hand side of the equation cancel. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;62&quot; width=&quot;97&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0005.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;3) I is then  left in terms of V and R. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;57&quot; width=&quot;61&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0006.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;  &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;4) Substitute  in the values for V(Voltage) and R(Resistance). &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;57&quot; width=&quot;70&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0007.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;5) Solve for  I(Current). &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;32&quot; width=&quot;160&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0008.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Using the Simulator you can verify the voltage and current by first creating the above circuit and measuring the current and voltage using voltmeter and ammeter respectively.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;249&quot; width=&quot;333&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image0009.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
  75      (296,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Components&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tResistor:&lt;/strong&gt; A resistor is a two-terminal electronic component that produces a voltage across its terminals that is proportional to the electric current through it in accordance with Ohm&#039;s law.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tLamp:&lt;/strong&gt; A lamp is a replaceable component such as an incandescent light bulb, which is designed to produce light from electricity. These components usually have a base of ceramic, metal, glass or plastic, which makes an electrical connection in the socket of a light fixture.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tWire:&lt;/strong&gt; A wire is a single, usually cylindrical, elongated string of metal. Wires are used to bear mechanical loads and to carry electricity and telecommunications signals. Wire is commonly formed by drawing the metal through a hole in a die or draw plate.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tSwitch:&lt;/strong&gt; In electronics, a switch is an electrical component that can break an electrical circuit, interrupting the current or diverting it from one conductor to another.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tBattery:&lt;/strong&gt; In electronics, a battery or voltaic cell is a combination of many electrochemical Galvanic cells of identical type to store chemical energy and to deliver higher voltage or higher current than with single cells.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tVoltmeter:&lt;/strong&gt; A voltmeter is an instrument used for measuring the electrical potential difference between two points in an electric circuit. Analog voltmeters move a pointer across a scale in proportion to the voltage of the circuit; digital voltmeters give a numerical display of voltage by use of an analog to digital converter.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tAmmeter:&lt;/strong&gt; An ammeter is a measuring instrument used to measure the electric current in a circuit. Electric currents are measured in amperes (A), hence the name.&#039;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&amp;bull;\tNon-contact ammeter:&lt;/strong&gt; A type of ammeter that need not be a part of the circuit.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;     &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
  76      (300,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;For more info on DC circuits one may read books, visit labs or check for other web contents. Here are some choices for reading material.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Reference:&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;       &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot; class=&quot;content&quot; id=&quot;myTable&quot;&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;3%&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;97%&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: block;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9780891001218&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Rosen, Stan. D. C. Circuits. Riverton: Aviation Maintenance Publishers, 1980.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\r\n            &lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;script src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books?jscmd=viewapi&amp;amp;bibkeys=ISBN:9780891001218&amp;amp;callback=processDynamicLinksResponse&quot; type=&quot;text/javascript&quot;&gt;&lt;/script&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;2.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Robert C. Carter, Introduction to electrical circuit analysis, Holt, Rinehart and Winston, 1966.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n&lt;/table&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;       &lt;!--\r\n&lt;body onUnload=&quot;checkEmbeddability();&quot; &gt;\r\n&lt;/body&gt;\r\n--&gt;       &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Webliography:/p&amp;gt;        &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;blockquote&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; 1.\tModified Nodal Analysis. [ &lt;/span&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://www.swarthmore.edu/NatSci/echeeve1/Ref/mna/MNA1.html&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://www.swarthmore.edu/NatSci/echeeve1/Ref/mna/MNA1.html&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; ]&lt;br /&gt;\r\n2.\tMatrix operations. [ &lt;/span&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LU_decomposition&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/LU_decomposition&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; ]&lt;br /&gt;\r\n3.\tGraph theory. [ &lt;/span&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_theory&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Graph_theory &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;]&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;/blockquote&gt;\r\n&lt;div class=&quot;postConentPadding&quot;&gt;\r\n&lt;link type=&quot;text/css&quot; rel=&quot;stylesheet&quot; href=&quot;http://sakshat.amrita.ac.in/VirtualLab/css/default.css&quot; /&gt;&lt;style type=&quot;text/css&quot;&gt;&lt;/style&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;  &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;\r\n&lt;div style=&quot;padding-left: 50px;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; &lt;strong&gt;Experiment Mapping &lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;\r\n&lt;table width=&quot;85%&quot;&gt;\r\n    &lt;caption class=&quot;tableHeading&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp; &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/caption&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;tagExpHead&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;th width=&quot;33%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Subject&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n            &lt;th width=&quot;33%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Courses&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n            &lt;th width=&quot;34%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;span class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;Level&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/th&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;txtarea&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td colspan=&quot;3&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Physics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- Electrostatics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;5%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- Quantitative Circuit Analysis&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n            &lt;/table&gt;\r\n            &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n            &lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;IIT Bombay&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;10%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- B Tech All Branches&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;10%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- M Sc Physics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n            &lt;/table&gt;\r\n            &lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Under Graduate (UG)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;95%&quot; colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Graduate (G)&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n            &lt;/table&gt;\r\n            &lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n&lt;/table&gt;\r\n&lt;/div&gt;\r\n&lt;/div&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
  77      (372,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Objectives&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;85%&quot;&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;56%&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;\r\n            &lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1)\tTo revise the concept of interference of light waves in general and thin-film interference in particular.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            2)\tTo set up and observe Newton&amp;rsquo;s rings&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            3) To determine the radius of curvature of one surface of a lens by measuring the size of Newton&amp;rsquo;s rings and analyzing the result.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            4)\tTo analyze prints of the photographs of rings with different liquids of different refractive indices. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n            &lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n            &lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Thin film  interference&lt;/strong&gt;:&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            &lt;br /&gt;\r\n            &amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;&amp;nbsp;A film is said to be thin when its thickness is about the order of one wavelength of visible light which is taken to be 550 nm.&amp;nbsp; When light is incident on such a film, a small portion gets reflected from the upper surface and a major portion is transmitted into the film.&amp;nbsp;Again a small part of the transmitted component is reflected&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n            &lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;45%&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;273&quot; width=&quot;388&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/NRings.gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n            &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n        &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n    &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n&lt;/table&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;back into the film by the lower surface and the rest of it emerges out of the film. These reflected beams reunite to produce interference.&amp;nbsp; Also the transmitted beams too interfere.&amp;nbsp; This type of interference taking place in thin films is called &lt;strong&gt;interference by division of amplitude&lt;/strong&gt;.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;img height=&quot;578&quot; width=&quot;522&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image001.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;In the above figure the rays r&lt;sub&gt;12&lt;/sub&gt;  and t&lt;sub&gt;21&lt;/sub&gt;   interfere and results in a constructive or destructive interference depending  on their path differences given as&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;28&quot; width=&quot;210&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image003.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;strong&gt;constructive  interference&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;20&quot; width=&quot;159&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image005.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;destructive  interference&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Where &lt;img height=&quot;20&quot; width=&quot;34&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image007.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt; refractive index of medium 2 and&amp;nbsp;&lt;img height=&quot;20&quot; width=&quot;100&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image009.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;the order of interference&amp;nbsp;  \t  &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;The transmitted light from t&lt;sub&gt;23&lt;/sub&gt; can also interfere and  result in constructive or destructive interference. &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Thin film interference with  films of varying thickness (Newton&amp;rsquo;s rings):&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Rings are fringes of equal thickness.&amp;nbsp; They are observed when light is reflected from a plano-convex lens of a long focal length placed in contact with a plane glass plate.&amp;nbsp; A thin air film is formed between the plate and the lens.&amp;nbsp; The thickness of the air film varies from zero at the point of contact to some value t.&amp;nbsp; If the lens plate system is illuminated with monochromatic light falling on it normally, concentric bright and dark interference rings are observed in reflected light.&amp;nbsp; These circular fringes were discovered by Newton and are called Newton&amp;rsquo;s rings.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;262&quot; width=&quot;405&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/theory_clip_image001(2).gif&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;A ray AB incident normally on the system gets partially reflected at the bottom curved surface of the lens (ray 1) and part of the transmitted ray is partially reflected (ray 2) from the top surface of the plane glass plate.&amp;nbsp; The rays 1 and 2 are derived from the same incident ray by division of amplitude and therefore are coherent.&amp;nbsp; Ray 2 undergoes a phase change of p upon reflection since it is reflected from air-to-glass boundary.&amp;nbsp; &lt;br /&gt;\r\nThe condition for  constructive and destructive interferences are given as&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Where, for normal incidence, &amp;nbsp;&lt;strong&gt;cos r =  1&lt;/strong&gt; and for air film &lt;img height=&quot;10&quot; width=&quot;9&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/u-horizontal.jpg&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt; &lt;strong&gt;= 1&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;28&quot; width=&quot;130&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image012.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;constructive  interference&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;20&quot; width=&quot;82&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image014.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;strong&gt;destructive interference&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(1)\t&lt;strong&gt;Central dark spot &lt;/strong&gt;: At the point of contact of the lens with the glass plate the thickness of the air film is very small compared to the wavelength of light therefore the path difference introduced between the interfering waves is zero. Consequently, the interfering waves at the centre are opposite in phase and interfere destructively. Thus a dark spot is produced.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; \t  &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(2) &lt;strong&gt;Circular fringes with equal thickness&lt;/strong&gt;: Each maximum or minimum is a locus of constant film thickness. Since the locus of points having the same thickness fall on a circle having its centre at the point of contact, the fringes are circular.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt; \t &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(3)&lt;strong&gt;\tFringes are localized&lt;/strong&gt;: Though the system is illuminated with a parallel beam of light, the reflected rays are not parallel. They interfere nearer to the top surface of the air film and appear to diverge from there when viewed from the top. The fringes are seen near the upper surface of the film and hence are said to be localized in the film.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n(4)&lt;strong&gt; Radii of the m&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt;dark rings&lt;/strong&gt;: &lt;img height=&quot;22&quot; width=&quot;94&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image016(1).png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(5)&lt;strong&gt;Radii of the mth bright ring&lt;/strong&gt; : &lt;img height=&quot;38&quot; width=&quot;139&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image018.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(6) The radius of a dark ring is proportional to the radius of curvature of the lens by the relation&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;22&quot; width=&quot;59&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image020.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;7) Rings get closer as the order increases (m increases) since the diameter does not increase in the same proportion. \t  &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(8) In transmitted light the ring system is exactly complementary to the reflected ring system so that the centre spot is bright.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(9) Under white light we get coloured fringes.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(10) The wavelength of monochromatic light can be determined as &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;41&quot; width=&quot;108&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image022.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;where,&amp;nbsp; D &lt;sub&gt;m+p&lt;/sub&gt;is the diameter of the (m+p)&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt;   dark ring&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p align=&quot;left&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;D&lt;sub&gt;m&lt;/sub&gt;is the diameter of the m&lt;sup&gt;th&lt;/sup&gt;dark ring&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;(11) If the air film is substituted by the liquid film, then the refractive index of the liquid is given by&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: center;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;img height=&quot;53&quot; width=&quot;196&quot; src=&quot;DATABASEPROJECTROOTFOLDERNAMEuserfiles/image024.png&quot; alt=&quot;&quot; /&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot; style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p style=&quot;text-align: left;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/p&gt;'),
  78      (373,'&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;strong&gt;Performing the Simulation&lt;/strong&gt;:&lt;br /&gt;\r\nThe simulation virtualizes the Newton&amp;rsquo;s rings experiment. The user can view the effect of Newton&amp;rsquo;s rings formed when the medium changes. Select any one type of medium.&amp;nbsp; Changing the radius of Curvature of the lens and Wavelength of light used different ring patterns are seen.&amp;nbsp; &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;Components&lt;/strong&gt;:&lt;br /&gt;\r\nStart  button, Light source, Filter, Microscope, Lens, Medium, Glass plate&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;Help&lt;/strong&gt; &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;&lt;u&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/u&gt;Variable  Region&lt;/strong&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n1. Choose Medium Combo box helps you to choose the type of medium that the  simulation have to perform.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n2. Radius Slider The slider is fixes helps to change the radius of curvature of  lens.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n3. The wavelength slider helps to change the wavelength of light used.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;strong&gt;Measurement Region &lt;/strong&gt;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1. The start button will help play the  simulation.&lt;br /&gt;\r\n2.The variation in the rings can be  seen when change of medium, radius and wavelength       &lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;'),
  79      (377,'&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Books&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;blockquote&gt;\r\n&lt;table border=&quot;0&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot; class=&quot;content&quot; id=&quot;myTable&quot;&gt;\r\n    &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n        &lt;tr class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;3%&quot; valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;1.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td width=&quot;97%&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;div style=&quot;display: block;&quot; id=&quot;ISBN:9780495386933&quot;&gt;&lt;a href=&quot;javascript:togglePreview(&#039;9780495386933&#039;);&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Serway, Raymond et.al. College Physics. Belmont: Brooks/Cole, Cengage Learning, 2009.&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;/div&gt;\r\n            &lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;script src=&quot;http://books.google.com/books?jscmd=viewapi&amp;amp;bibkeys=ISBN:9780495386933&amp;amp;callback=processDynamicLinksResponse&quot;         &lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/blockquote&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Webliography&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; href=&quot;http://extraphysics.com/java/models/newtRings.html&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;http://extraphysics.com/java/models/newtRings.html&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/a&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;br /&gt;\r\n&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;contentTitleSmall&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Video References&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/p&gt;\r\n&lt;p class=&quot;content&quot;&gt;&lt;a target=&quot;_blank&quot; width=&quot;100%&quot;&gt;\r\n                &lt;tbody&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td colspan=&quot;2&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;Amrita Viswa Vidyapeetham&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                    &lt;tr&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;10%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;&amp;nbsp;&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                        &lt;td width=&quot;90%&quot;&gt;&lt;span style=&quot;font-family: Verdana;&quot;&gt;- M Sc Integrated Physics&lt;/span&gt;&lt;/td&gt;\r\n                    &lt;/tr&gt;\r\n                &lt;/tbody&gt;\r\n            &lt;/table&gt;\r\n            &lt;/td&gt;\r\n            &lt;td valign=&quot;top&quot;&gt;\r\n            &lt;table border=&quot;0&quot;
